messages.title: LABOUR SHOCK
messages.content: Lifelong Labour member and MP for Dudley North has quit Labour. Ian Austin says he can no longer ask people to vote Labour. It has been 'poisoned by racism, extremism and intolerance' under Jeremy Corbyn. His comments have been echoed by two other former Labour MPs – John Woodcock and Tom Harris. They are all urging people to vote Tory – because Jeremy Corbyn is unfit to run the country.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Ian Austin, John Woodcock, Tom Harris
mentions.tacticalSituation: The only way to get a Government led by Boris Johnson is to vote Conservative here in Bury South.

quotes.text: Ian Austin quits the party over 'culture of antisemitism'
Labour voters abandon party after Ian Austin call to vote Tory
[Ian Austin] claimed Jeremy Corbyn is 'completely unfit' to run the country
MP John Woodcock quits Labour with attack on 'hard left'
John Woodcock backs Tory Barrow candidate over 'Corbyn's man'
Vote Tory, urge Ian Austin and two other former Labour MPs
More and more Labour supporters say Jeremy Corbyn doesn't represent real Labour values. Don't risk making him Prime Minister - for five long years.

images.caption: Former Labour MP for Dudley North, Ian Austin, urging people to vote Tory.
